Smart Meeting Room
  • Project API Documentation
  • View page source

Project API Documentation

This documentation covers the four microservices that make up the Smart Meeting Room system.

Users Service

API Endpoints

users_service.app.delete_user(username)[source]

Permanently delete a user account from the database.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the account to delete.

Returns:

JSON success or error message.

Return type:

tuple

users_service.app.get_user(username)[source]

Retrieve user details by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The unique username of the usre to retrieve

Returns:

JSON user object or error message

Return type:

tuple

users_service.app.get_user_bookings(username)[source]

Retrieve the booking history for a specific user.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username to fetch bookings for.

Returns:

JSON list of bookings or error message.

Return type:

tuple

users_service.app.login()[source]

Authenticate a user and return their details.

Expected JSON input:

  • username (str): Login username of the user

  • password (str): Login password of the user

Returns:

JSON response containing the user object and success message.

Return type:

tuple

users_service.app.register()[source]

Register a new user in the system.

Expected JSON input:

  • full_name (str): Full name of the user

  • username (str): Unique username for the user

  • email (str): Email address of the user

  • password (str): Plain text password for the user account (will be hashed)

  • role (str): Role of the user

Returns:

JSON response indicating success or failure of registration.

Return type:

tuple

users_service.app.update_user(username)[source]

Update user details by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the user to update

Returns:

JSON success message.

Return type:

tuple

Data Models

class users_service.models.User(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a user in the system.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the user.

  • full_name (str) – Full name of the user.

  • username (str) – Unique username for the user.

  • email (str) – Unique email address of the user.

  • password (str) – Hashed password for the user.

  • role (str) – Role of the user (e.g., admin, user).

email
full_name
id
password
query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

role

Converts the User object to a dictionary.

Returns:

Dictionary representation of the User object.

Reviews Service

API Endpoints

reviews_service.app.delete_review(review_id)[source]

Delete a review.

Parameters:

review_id (int) – The ID of the review to delete.

Returns:

JSON success message.

Return type:

tuple

reviews_service.app.get_room_reviews(room_id)[source]

Retrieve all reviews for a specific meeting room.

Note: This endpoint filters out reviews where is_flagged is True, ensuring that only appropriate content is returned to users.

Parameters:

room_id (int) – The ID of the meeting room.

Returns:

JSON list of reviews.

Return type:

tuple

reviews_service.app.moderate_review(review_id)[source]

Flags a review as inappropriate (Moderation Feature).

Expected JSON Input:

  • action (str): Must be “flag” to hide the review.

  • reason (str): Optional reason for flagging.

Parameters:

review_id (int) – The ID of the review to moderate.

Returns:

JSON success message.

Return type:

tuple

reviews_service.app.submit_review()[source]

Submit a new review for a meeting room.

Expected JSON Input:

  • user_username (str): The username of the reviewer.

  • room_id (int): The ID of the meeting room being reviewed.

  • rating (int): The rating given to the room (1-5).

  • comment (str): the review text (will be sanitized).

Returns:

JSON success message.

Return type:

tuple

reviews_service.app.update_review(review_id)[source]

Update an existing review.

Expected JSON Input:

  • rating (int): The updated rating (1-5).

  • comment (str): The updated comment.

Parameters:

review_id (int) – The ID of the review to update.

Returns:

JSON success message.

Return type:

tuple

Data Models

class reviews_service.models.Review(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a user review for a specific room

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the review.

  • user_username (str) – Username of the user who wrote the review.

  • room_id (int) – ID of the room being reviewed.

  • rating (int) – Rating given by the user (1-5).

  • comment (str) – Comment provided by the user.

  • timestamp (datetime) – Date and time when the review was created.

  • is_flagged (bool) – Moderation status.

comment
id
is_flagged
query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

rating
room_id
timestamp
to_dict()[source]

Converts the Review object to a dictionary.

Returns:

Dictionary representation of the Review object.

Return type:

dict

user_username

Rooms Service

API Endpoints

rooms_service.app.create_room()[source]

Creates a new meeting room.

Expected JSON input:

  • name (str): Name of the room

  • capacity (int): Maximum number of people in the room

  • equipment (str): Equipment available in the room

  • location (str): Location of the room

Returns:

JSON message and status code 201

Return type:

tuple

rooms_service.app.delete_room(id)[source]

Deletes a room by ID.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the room to delete

Returns:

JSON message

Return type:

tuple

rooms_service.app.get_rooms()[source]

Retrieves available rooms based on capacity, location, and equipment.

Parameters:

  • capacity (-) – Minimum capacity required.

  • location (-) – Substring match for location.

  • equipment (-) – Substring match for equipment.

Returns:

List of room objects matching the criteria.

Return type:

tuple

rooms_service.app.update_room(id)[source]

Updates room details (capacity, equipment).

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the room to update

Returns:

JSON message

Return type:

tuple

Data Models

class rooms_service.models.Room(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a meeting room in the system.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the room.

  • name (str) – Name of the room.

  • capacity (int) – Maximum number of people in the room.

  • equipment (str) – Equipment available in the room.

  • location (str) – Location of the room.

capacity
equipment

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

to_dict()[source]

Converts the Room object to a dictionary.

Bookings Service

API Endpoints

bookings_service.app.cancel_booking(id)[source]

Cancels (deletes) a booking by ID.

Parameters:

id (int) – ID of the booking to cancel.

Returns:

JSON success message.

Return type:

tuple

bookings_service.app.check_availability()[source]

Checks if a room is available for a specific time slot.

Expected JSON input:

  • room_id (int)

  • start_time (str)

  • end_time (str)

Returns:

JSON availability status.

Return type:

tuple

bookings_service.app.create_booking()[source]

Creates a booking if the room is available. checks for time conflicts before saving.

Expected JSON input:

  • user_id (int)

  • room_id (int)

  • start_time (str): ISO format datetime string

  • end_time (str): ISO format datetime string

Returns:

JSON success message or 409 conflict error.

Return type:

tuple

bookings_service.app.get_bookings()[source]

Retrieves all bookings.

Returns:

List of all bookings.

Return type:

tuple

Data Models

class bookings_service.models.Booking(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a booking reservation for a room.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the booking.

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user who made the booking.

  • room_id (int) – ID of the room being booked.

  • start_time (datetime) – Start date and time of the booking.

  • end_time (datetime) – End date and time of the booking.

end_time
id
query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

room_id
start_time
to_dict()[source]

Converts the Booking object to a dictionary.

Returns:

Dictionary representation of the Booking object.

Return type:

dict
